skill.name: clinical-decision-support
skill.description: Generate professional clinical decision support (CDS) documents for pharmaceutical and clinical research settings, including patient cohort analyses (biomarker-stratified with outcomes) and treatment recommendation reports (evidence-based guidelines with decision algorithms). Supports GRADE evidence grading, statistical analysis (hazard ratios, survival curves, waterfall plots), biomarker integration, and regulatory compliance. Outputs publication-ready LaTeX/PDF format optimized for drug development, clinical research, and evidence synthesis.
skill.summary: Generate professional clinical decision support (CDS) documents for pharmaceutical and clinical rese...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No data theft, exfiltration, or malicious execution patterns were found. Scripts focus on statistical analysis, document validation, and LaTeX generation without network or system access.

content.value_statement: Creating compliant CDS documents is slow and error prone. This skill generates structured analyses, tables, and diagrams for clinical research workflows.
actual_capabilities: Classify biomarkers into binary, categorical, or subtype groups from tabular data
Generate cohort baseline and outcomes tables with statistical comparisons
Create Kaplan-Meier survival curves with log-rank tests and median survival
Build TikZ decision tree flowcharts from text or YAML descriptions
Validate CDS documents for required sections, citations, and HIPAA identifiers
limitations: Does not create individual patient treatment plans
Requires structured input data provided by the user
Does not automatically fetch or verify external literature
Outputs LaTeX and figures but does not compile or submit them

use_cases.title: Cohort outcomes report
use_cases.description: Analyze biomarker strata and survival outcomes for a trial cohort.

use_cases.title: Guideline recommendation draft
use_cases.description: Draft evidence graded recommendations and decision algorithms.

use_cases.title: Real world evidence summary
use_cases.description: Summarize subgroup effectiveness with tables and plots.

prompt_templates.title: Baseline cohort table
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a baseline characteristics table for two groups in my CSV. Include p-values and note nonnormal variables.

prompt_templates.title: Biomarker stratification
prompt_templates.prompt: Classify HER2 status using IHC and FISH columns and summarize category counts.

prompt_templates.title: Survival curve report
prompt_templates.prompt: Build Kaplan-Meier curves by biomarker group with log-rank test and median survival annotations.

prompt_templates.title: Decision tree flowchart
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert a text decision pathway into TikZ and output a flowchart-ready LaTeX file.

output_examples.input: Create a biomarker stratified cohort analysis for EGFR in NSCLC with OS and PFS results.
output: Biomarker group counts and distribution summary
Key findings and clinical implications section

best_practices: Provide de-identified datasets and clear biomarker definitions
Specify endpoints, units, and statistical assumptions up front
Review GRADE strength and evidence quality before publishing
anti_patterns: Include identifiable patient data in inputs
Ask for external API calls or web scraping

faq.question: Which platforms are supported?
faq.answer: It is designed for Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows using local files.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It does not replace clinical judgment and requires structured input data.

faq.question: Can I integrate with existing pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, scripts accept CSV inputs and output LaTeX or figures for pipelines.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The skill does not transmit data or call external services by default.

faq.question: What if validation fails?
faq.answer: Review missing sections, citations, and formatting warnings in the report.

faq.question: How does it compare to general writing tools?
faq.answer: It provides domain specific analysis, templates, and statistical tooling.
